page.title: 01A view from Faire Mhot
page.content: This area is sparsely populated with scattered mixed farmland and farmhouses offering bed/breakfast. The landscape is mainly purpose planted coniferous trees on the mountainside with deciduous trees and open grassland and farmland in the dales. North east is Faire Mhot, a mountain which stands 1592 feet above sea level. The south easterly point is Lochbroom Burn which joins the River Tummel. It is popular for salmon fishing. South westerly point is East Hough, a hamlet of few people but has a small pottery, tea room, arts and crafts gallery, agricultural supplier and a preparitry school. There is a daily bus service. The north westerly point is Edrodour where there is a whiskey distillery, a hotel and a childrens' home.
